content:
SMTP is an outgoing protocol and while there are some providers that use the same server name for incoming and outgoing generally they use a port to determine the protocol that answers when a request is made to the server.

Note that generally it is antivirus programs that mess up account creation. That outlook works and Thunderbird does not on the same device actually increases the chance of it being antivirus related as Outlook relies on the Windows certificate store for encryption and it is very easily manipulated programmatically to add dud certifying authorities. Thunderbird has no programmatic manipulation, instead requiring a manual adding of "new" trusted certifying authorities. So if you are using SSL/TLS or StartTLS then my guess is your antivirus is the root problem.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Please follow the links on donations pages to read the faq on why you are asked for your name and address. The same page says "If you need help donating to Thunderbird and did not find an answer in our FAQs, please fill out this form" but instead of doing that you chose to use the link to Technical Support.

Your question is not technical support and is simply inappropriate for a peer support forum such as this so I am closing it. The people who answer questions here, for the most part, are other users volunteering their time (like me), not Mozilla employees. Perhaps use the link in the donor help page to complete the form and get your response from those that are employed in donor support. No one here is even competent to answer the question.
creator: MattAuSupport
